Ricky bursts out laughing
And there's no- you're not getting any return for your cash?
Well, it's just how many times you know, they've gotta learn.
What do you mean they gotta learn? what you're gonna teach 'em a lesson?
What do you mean they've got to learn? What do you mean?
Well what are they doing with it?
Get - they must have, like, better interest accounts, or something where, you know, look after'd, that they put the money in the right thing.
Sorry, do you think that Bob Geldof sort of write them a check? He goes over and he's in the helicopter and there's there's millions of them and there's Geldof from Boomtown Rats.
Brilliant, if there's one man that can help us.

I hope he doesn't sing, he's not going to sing, he's got some money for us, and he comes down and he goes there you are, to want to check or detects quick second. We don't take switch because there's a check, they they get things like-
He's doing it again though, isn't he, as well? You know, I like, he used to work here, Bob. He's is lovely fellow-
Yeah, he's a lovely man.
But how many times can save the world?
Yeah?...
He's over there again, helping out, and it's like well, you know, what do you do?
Are you saying don't bother because it keeps happening.
No, well, I'm not saying that, you know what I mean, I'm not daft.
But that's what you're thinking.
And Karl, you are daft.
Yeah, exactly.
I just, I don't know what the answer is, you know what I mean?
So you're just saying, wash your hands of the whole affair, leave them to it.
Yeah.
Sure.
Are you really, just saying it's sort of its nature, it's tough luck, just don't interfere, like a wildlife program. Is that what you're saying? Don't interfere?
Are you basically saying it's not my concern?
This has got a bit heavy, can we do cheeky freak of the week?
Ricky & Steve Laugh
Let's play a record.
(Laughing) Oh God -

metadata.song_track: My My, Hey Hey (Out Of The Blue)

transcript.content: Neil Young, "My My, Hey Hey (Out of the Blue)"
My My, Hey Hey (Out of the Blue), from the album Rust Never Sleeps by Neil Young
Such a brilliant song.
He's a great, great, musician.
He's amazing.
Yeah.
He's incredible. I think we'll play a Neil Young track a week.
Okay
From now, until Christmas
Brilliant. Okay.
All right?
Excellent
On Xfm 104.9, I'm Ricky Gervais, with me, Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington.

We were talking about the homeless; I saw a homeless guy in the week as I was walking in Finchley Road, and he was peering in the window of one of, the, Dixon's, or something like that. Just checking out the details on one of those cable TV packages. And I thought, one step at a time, I mean, firstly, I don't know, start eating your dinner off a plate.
Yeah
And then work your way up to you know, a house, a home, a wide-screen TV.
A roof.
Digital Television, but it's odd-

Well, that, that might answer one of my questions, because I keep getting recognized by homeless people. and I never know what to say. I go "Oh..." either they, they're not really homeless, I don't know, they've got sort of digs or something and they watch television, or the scariest one, is that, they, they've become homeless in the last few months-
Sure
I think, "Oh God, that's really scary", or they are watching it in Dixon's, they're cueing up, "oh, the office is on tonight."
Yeah
"What are you doing? "Oh, going round to Dixon's".
Or they think you're one of them, because I mean, the way you dress...

Well, I have had, some that are probably in the not quite, yeah, got their faculties, and maybe a little bit worse for wear, um, think they recognize me, and they have whole scenarios where they're going, "Remember when we were chatting." I was going, "Yeah, Yeah, how are you?" and it's just they recognize someone-
Right, Yeah
But, that's- that's a bit weird. But I mean, I think that's the worst thing, homeless. On a serious note, it is, outside Health, where we're talking about -

...Charity, and I sort of got these standing orders where I've been sort-of caught in the street, but the ones that I choose, I'd always think... Charity is what touches you. You can't change the world, but you can change your bit. So cancer obviously because my mum so give to cancer. And I think outside Health the next one must be being homeless because there's nothing you can do. It's got everything. It's... you're scared, it's cold. It's just everything even if you're healthy and homeless eventually you're not going to be.
Well I just - I do feel bad because you know, I -
I always feel that I want to give to the, the health Charities. Cancer for instance. Because there's that fear that I might get it.

Wh- yeah, it's not just that it's just like yeah, if you're not health... that's the first thing, isn't it? If your life - if your life's being threatened there's nothing else you can really worry about.
Yeah, yeah yeah.
But uhh...
Don't know if that makes it wrong though, that I'm sort of it's like I'm investing in a possible future.
Yeah. Well, not really because it's the same for everyone isn't it? But umm, you know, oh...
I saw a homeless guy as well umm looking through the bins, but he wasn't putting out food scraps he was pulling up newspapers. Just having a read.
Yeah.
I was always find that odd. I see that a lot - homeless guys. I don't know if they're just check it out the TV listings, for when he finally gets his...
When's The Office on?
Thing.
Yeah. The Office. They've moved it. I've moved it to Choice and UK Gold.

I don't -  I mean I don't blame them because I mean there is some cracking stuff on cable TV, err, there's great stuff. I was flicking through the other day and on digital TV, you can see what other shows are on while you're watching something. I was looking through and there was one, and it was called know.
Now, when are you ever in the mood to watch a TV show called "I survived a 200 pound tumor"?
When was that on?
Because it seems to me that you've got a 200 pound tumor you'll probably want to watch something else that'll take your mind off it Big Brother or whatever...
I'm not 200 pounds!
Well, I do I can't imagine what this is.
A 200-pound tumor?
It must have been an error - 200 pound tumor?
It must have been a 200 pound tuna. It was probably someone fell in the water and it came at him.
(laughing) Yeah, I survived a 200 pound tuna.
Yeah, and it was just a spelling mistake.
Sure...
A 200-pound tumor!
That's like... isn't that like kind of having Mr. T attached to you?
That's a person!
Oh my God, maybe, It was... all his life they told him it was a Siamese twin but someone had just paint a little face on it when he was at school.
Just drawn a little face on.
Exactly. And they go "it's not your twin brother" he goes, "isn't it?" - "no it's a tumor, we better take off". It's 200 pounds.
200 pounds!
That can't be right. Sure it wasn't 20 pounds?
I'm assuming that's what it would be probably would have been. But it was certainly 200 pounds on the digital thing. Maybe that's a mistake.
That's great, isn't it?
They're trying to make it more interesting.
Yes.
It's someone like Karl working there. "20 pound tumor? Let's make it 200, at least they'll watch"
Yeah exactly.
That's what I'd be like though, I wouldn't want to go to the doctors? You know what I'm like.
A 200 pound tumor?
I know... it's just that thing. I mean, you know how I'm like, I don't like - it depends where it is as well, taking your clothes off and all that. It's the pressure isn't it?
You know like anything being touched do you?
I just don't like doctors...
I remember when he said he doesn't check his balls because he doesn't like the feel. That's lived with me.

He doesn't like the feel. I think do you mean that you don't like what it feels like in your balls when you're fiddling with them? Cos I imagined it that you meant you don't like the feel i.e. in your fingertips. You don't like the feel of your balls.
It's the thing of you start thinking about what you're actually touching and there's something in there and you might break 'em and all that. I don't like
Ricky Laughs
And they are delicate. I am scared with the little knobbly bits.
What knobbly bits?!
Ricky laughs hysterically
But I'll tell you what it's that thought at the

At the uh, at the doctors. It's that thing of it's not taking your clothes off in front of him. All right, it's the way you've got to take your clothes off. But he asks you to go behind that curtain to do it first. So there's more pressure because then you come walking out with nothing on.
Ricky Laughs
It's like why did you ask me to go behind there
Yeah.
Rather than if I just sat there having a chat and he's going so "How have you been? and it's like "Alright" just takin' the pants off and then it's the pressure of
Yeah. Exactly. What if he's like "don't take your clothes off" and you came out and he'd lit a candle
The lights went down
And there was some soft music on "doo-doo-doo doo-doo doo-dah". Mmm nice. "doo doo doo".
Or He said if you'll make you feel more relaxed, I'll take my clothes off.
Yeah, exactly, yeah
But I'll do it in the form of a striptease
Now, now Karl, I'm gonna ask you the question (knowing the answer!). What do you think of um, maybe a gay doctor  just checking your testicles out? He's a professional, just happens to be gay
That would never happen would it.
What are you talking about? Why not?
Oh! Speaking of <camp whistle>
Doctors?
No, gay people n'that. Do you know when we discussed
Uh, gay only toilets.
Yeah
Mmm-hmm
It's only, uh, it looks like it's coming into action.
No it doesn't
Right
No way.
It was mentioned again.
Where?
On
Your head.
No, I think
Do you think that people in positions of power are listening to the show getting ideas from you.
Tony Blair.
Makes you wonder doesn't it?
Ricky laughs
No it really does. And the funny thing is why are they getting upset?
Why are gay people getting upset that they might have to their own toilets
Karl you don't know what you're talking about anymore
You don't know what you're talking about
Having a sly look.
Ricky laughs
You don't know what you're talking about. Okay, can we have cheeky freak after this?
If you want
Placebo - This Picture
Placebo - This picture on Xfm 104.9. Steve you're thinking of taking over as producer aren't you?
Well, I just think it's a shambles. I've asked for cheeky freak of the week and it appears that Karl's not ready. He's not prepared.
No, I can sort of remember it. It's just that I like to have all the information
Contempt, contempt for the listener
But you've just had a whole bunch of adverts and Placebo in order to get ready
I know but we were chatting, we're having a chat n'that
Right well do you wanna to sort yourself out future?

Yeah. Someone emailed, that's what we're chatting about. Someone emailed in about they watched the 200-pound tumor thing and when it was removed, it was carried away in a wheelbarrow. All right? Karl said "What even when she had it removed she still carried it around in a wheelbarrow" and he went "I thought it sort of like she's sort of like
Become attached to it."
Steve laughs
I think, I mean you are you definitely are my favorite thing in the world. It's great. Look at the way he's looking back!
I think they're all the same, the people. I mean, I've had more emails about people saying "I watched the 200-pound tumor documentary"
And I shaved my arse
Than anything else!
We come up with science concepts, we talk about political issues
One person emailed in, they said "I tuned in to the 200-pound tumor documentary. It looked disgusting. I couldn't watch for long." What were you expecting?!
Yeah
That it might sing and dance?
Ricky laughs
Put on a show for ya!
Ahhhh
Anyway, so whats the s..
These are really your listeners, Karl, now. I think we've.. d'you know what I mean? You sort of find your niche, you attract your.. I think me and Steve are pretty much just here.
I think the people that we had in the early days, they've long since abandoned us, they jumped ship. I really..
They've got jobs. They've got jobs. They're out now. They've been released. They're getting their life back together.
Um, Karl..
Come on then, Karl.
What's the situation with Cheeky Freaks?
I've got like a couple of bits. Like I say, I'm haven't got the in-depth
Stuff that I normally..
Oh no, because usually it's, you know, it's pretty scientific.
Heavily researched.
Exactly. Yeah. Yeah do the jingle we gotta come up with a new one, haven't we?
The freak. C'est chic.
Cheeky freak of the week.
Right, well, couple of bits. I don't know which one to use as the main feature for this week.
It's that good, is it?
Well there's been another one born.
What?
A little kid.
New one.
Four Eyes.
Ricky and Steve laugh
Insult.
Just a guy who wears glasses, come on.
Four eyes. Two noses. Two mouths. That's weird. innit?
This bloke. Did he also have two heads? Two bodies? Sort of born sort of slightly separately?
He wasn't stood next to a mirror?
No, weird that, innit?
That's all you've got.
It's like, I love that. "That's weird, that?" Imagine if the doctor said that.
(impersonating a doctor) Well, um, Mrs. Parks. Um, kid's got four eyes and two noses, weird innit? Any clues?
Any clues?
So that's it. That's all the information..
That's it. That's one. Well I tell you what, that should be the main one. Ok..
No no no! But again, no but, but like I say, what's the idea of this feature? What do I say all the time?
Dunno.
I always say "Think about it, think about what would that be like?"
Okay
What? Giving birth to him, it, her?
No no no! I think it's a girl. Being like her. Two mouths.
Four eyes, what would that be like?
Mad, innit?
I don't know.. I don't know what this feature is.
I don't.. nor do I. Is there another one? Is that.. you said you had two?
I mean I hope everyone took the opportunity there, during that silence, just to think about what it would be like, I know I was.
Could she talk with her mouth full?
What?
Is that allowed?
'cause she's got two mouths?
Yeah.
Yeah.
Would that be alright in her house?
She'd be eating..
Yeah, she could talk with one mouth and eat with the other.
Right well listen, the main one, right? You've thought about that, that's good. The main Cheeky Freak of the Week. I'm haven't got all the details. Smallest person ever.
Ricky laughs.
Right? How big would you say
That is?
Karl is now, sort of, like, holding his hands up like a fisherman long ways. That's about 1 foot.
Right. Smallest, smallest man in the world. I printed the thing off and I can't find. There's a little picture of him, right? The odd thing was
But why have you asked me? How, did it say? Or was it a picture of him?
I didn't really read it.
Of for f-
Course you didn't.
Jeez.
I just saw it and thought, oh..
Right and you just straight away assumed it was natural size.
It was that big.
But what do you mean it was that big? Little fella, like that.
But why are you doing that what it was a page with a little fella out, you know, that was natural size?
No, it was because it said it's world's smallest man. And the funny thing is I've member. I've read the first line. I always read the first line. It said...
Well done. Well done.
The weird thing is you've got a head like a light bulb.
Ricky laughs
The shape of it apparently, I don't know if that's got anything to do with his shape and size
Oh God
That that big
His name is mr. Watts
And the annoying thing is, what got me is, if you're that big, yeah.
Don't have your picture taken next to a fruit bowl.
Why was having his photo taken next to a fruitbowl?
Sunno! whoever the photographer was, obviously having a bit of a laugh.
Yeah
At his expense - because you would just stand in the middle of nowhere. You look normal and that, way was it was stood there just leaning on an apple.
Ricky laughs
Leaning on an Apple?!
Why is this? in what world is this? Leaning on a... if I show their advertising? No, no, it was it was.
Leaning on a...! could you ah, sorry could you just...lean on the apple. just lean on the apple there, could you do me a favor and stand next to my chihuahua?
"you're not taking the piss are ya?"
No, not at all. Could you... do you mind leaning on this match box?
Yeah
Leaning on an apple. and that's where it's at... So it just said is the world's smallest man, leaning on an apple?

Smallest man, said about his had been like a light bulb? I don't know what that meant. And I thought "right that that'll do, that's that sorted. cheeky freak of the week done". I think that was on, like, Monday. right. I found that I thought "that's done" printed it off forgot to get it off the...
Photocopier... someone's nicked it
Play a record!
You've got to
It's just you... steve
No can I just say... karl please...
No point, there's no point.
If I say "let's actually cheeky freak the week" and you haven't done your research. You haven't got the information just tell us you can't do it but don't lead us on
Don't say on radio and hold your hand up to me and go 'ow tall is that!
It's nothing!
It's radio!
It's nothing!
I uh, think he's that big because he was leaning on an Apple.
It's not enough information!
Imagine Trevor McDonald coming are going... some news... some stuff. Uhh, how big's that?
How big d'youthink that is because,
Yeah
'cos there was a fella. Yeah coming up after Chris, more, Chris Tarrant. Play a record!
I just.... I'm angry. I'm actually angry. If monkey news is anyway in any way similar... You've really pulled your finger out with that have you. Lets have Rockbusters answers next.
Oasis - Supersonic

Supersonic Oasis on Xfm 104.9 right getting through it. It's the rock Busters. It's Rockbusters results really because this is umm.. and they're very important result is whether uhh, they, uuhh, stay in the Premiership or are relegated. This is the playoffs for Carl. Okay, you need three points. You need three points.
Stay up Karl. Go on.
Right, the, uh, there's a lot of right answers and that.
Okay, that's, that's, that's in your favor. You know. Okay.
The first clue was the doctor said part of the foot and the leg was no good. So you took them off, threw 'em away.
Yeah
The initials TB.
Yeah
Right?
Go on.
Toe, knee, bin it. All right, that's Tony Bennett. Tony Bennett.
Toe, knee, bin it.
Yeah.
Okay, that's a warning, that's a yellow card. That is as a yellow card, but you can still get the points.
Uhhh..
Because his name's not "Bin it".
Tony (Toe Knee), brilliant. Tony, perfect. A pun. Toe. Knee. His name's Tony. Perfect. "Bin it"? No his name's Bennett. See?
Well, he's at, he's, he's in London this week as well. So I don't know if it's sold out, I wouldn't mind..
Are you on drugs or, have you, did I actually crack your head? Did I actually give you some brain damage 'cause you're worse than usual now. It's like, go on.
Right, the second one. Uhh...
That Scottish fella.
We've gotta speed this show up.
Well hang on a minute, hang on, I've just gotta make sure it's right. We don't want to look stupid.
Ricky laughs.
That Scottish monster has got a bit of a tan.
I don't think we can look stupid with this material like this.
Right? T. T. D. That Scottish monster's got a bit of a tan, the answer there, the Dark Ness (Darkness).
I'll give you that.
All right?
Well done, goal.
And the last one.
Goal.
The '60s singer, he had a heart attack the other way, whilst having it away. We won't be seeing him again, the initials FNM. That's Faith No More.
Adam Faith, right?
(screaming) No!!! Doesn't count!
Why not?
Adam Faith No More.
Steve laughs.
Adam Faith No More? So, sorry, what is the clue? Is the clue "Adam Faith" or is it "Faith No More"?
Well it's faith I 'spose. Just "Faith No More". '60s singer.. So we got that. That's that. That's safe for next week. What, who's the winner?
What do you make of it? You've got the deciding vote, Rick. I mean you know my thoughts about it.
Well, I mean it works, but he's mixed-up what cryptic is in that 'cause it sta.. They fella, I mean Adam Faith, did actually die havin' it away, didn't he?
Yeah.
So it's all about about him.
It's all right, all the facts are right.
Anyway.
Okay, I think he's got a reprieve. I think I'll give it to him. I think I've got to give it to him, Steve. I think I have. He actually pulled that out of the bag that one.
Steve sighs.

There's no, there's no Jamaican fellas seein' icebergs or, you know, Wet Knee Houston. The closest he came to is Bennett Bin It, and I've gotta, give him, let him off that, I've gotta be a fair ref here.
Alright, well, fair enough and well done to, you know, I'm always a fan of names that for some reason just strike me or tickle me.
Yeah.
And this week the lucky winner is Dave Suckling.
Ricky laughs.
I, there's nothing, there's nothing amusing about that.
Oh, dear.
To one Dave suckling.
Okay, so well Suckling wins it. Suckling takes the prizes.
He takes the prizes and well done to him. I guess there's more of that next week and we're fast approaching the end of the show Rick. I know you are excited about that, as am I.
Well I know but the best to come because we've still got Bruce Springsteen coming up now followed by Monkey News.
Alright, Monkey News..
Is amazing. What an amazing show this is.
Bruce Springsteen - Atlantic City
Ricky playing electronic bongos
(screaming) Ohh!! Chimpanzee-
That. Monkey News.
Excellent. So Monkey News time. On Xfm, Karl Pilkington, the man in the hot seat. Karl, what have you got for us?
Okay Monkey News this week. We've covered a lot of stuff.
Ricky and Steve laugh
We have indeed.

Now d'you know, like, there's places where you can go for like weekend rests and stuff and you can, you relax, you're sitting in a little spa, you have a swim, and stuff. Well, they've got a place done for monkeys.
Course they have
Right. They can go there. They relax, forget all the stuff they've got going on their head. They can have a manicure. Nice meals.
It's not called a manicure though. It's called a chimpicure.
Beauty
Treatments..
Yeah.
Right. Look good and stuff.
Yeah, well loo, feel good. Yeah.
Now, you might think "Well that's pretty normal"
Well.
The bit I haven't told you about is it's actually run by a couple of chimps.
Ricky and Steve erupt in laughter (14 seconds)
Oh god, oh god, oh Karl, you're a maniac!
Right, quiet!
Oh for christs..
Steve shushs Karl
Let's just
(barely able to talk) Run by a couple of chimps... Of course it's not..
No no no, it is. Think about it.
Ricky laughs again
No, not think about it.
What do you mean, yes it is? Of course it's not run by a couple of chimps. What'd they do, get a loan?
Right, if a chimp wants to have a rest.
Yeah.
Where would you go to, a place that's run by humans, they don't know what chimps' needs are.
No! My points is this, how did they get it together? How did two, what, two chimps, what? Mr. and Mrs. Chimp went for a loan and said "Oh, I'll tell you what we need, a spa."
I think it started off quite simple. Right? Just, you know, basic, basic stuff.
But they expanded over time because it's become so popular.
It's gone mental down there.
Sure.
Ricky laughs.
Karl, I don't know..
They've all heard about it. Now the thing is, the problem is this, right? That isn't even the top and
Bottom of it, right?
Christ. I don't..

The problem is, it's been going on and on and on, right? It's been it's been earning a lot of money and stuff. The monkeys are happy. The monkeys that go there are loving it. They're telling friends and stuff. They're all coming to it. Now. The problem is, it's this little, little monkey, little man monkey and little woman monkey, right?
Yeah.
It was sort of girlfriend and boyfriend.
"Sort of"? It's an open relationship. They can play around if they want.
Well the problem is they're not married, right?

The lad monkey.
Fella monkey. He's getting quite old, and the problem is, because it's his name that's down on all the..
Karl, I don't..
Let him finish!
I'm getting scared now.
Let him finish.
It's his name on the business and the problem is

Sure.
What are you, where are you getting this from? What are?
Sound of crinkling paper.
Internet.
Karl, I don't know where to start.
Can we just hear the end?
This is ridiculous.
So the problem is
The, the, the..
Female monkey's worried that the male monkey is gonna die and
She's worried, what can happen, what's gonna happen with the business. What's going to happen?
Course
Right? Now.
(yelling) What do you mean the business?
The health spa.
There isn't a business. It's a joke.
Health spa...
Rick, you're not listening. His name's on the form.

The male monkey's name, it's in his name.

They're kids from a previous monkey marriage.
Yeah
Right

Karl makes a sound with his mouth, as if he is busy reading

Yeah, otherwise, you wanna check the facts. Otherwise, (putting on a silly voice) you could look like a twat. Spouting shit on the radio. Please check the facts for scientific.
They're just a bit worried because they're saying that the people in Ohio, which is where the where they've got the little health thing going on.
So it makes it more believable that it's Ohio. I thought you meant it was Berkshire in which case it would be rubbish.
It looks like the
Local people try to get in there. They've seen the success of it.
Sure.
And they're trying to go in take it over and stuff. So...
Yeah, give me the piece of paper.
Throw it away.

Play a record. That's the worst. That's the worst one I've ever heard and you are. There's something wrong with you. You're educationally subnormal.
Final tune from us. Tim Buckley. Lovely song called "Wings". Back next week?

Yep. See you Karl.

synopsis.description: Monkey news saved by overwhealming public support.
Worlds smallest man leans on an apple.
